Package model

Class PodcastPlayerModel

java.lang.Object
java.util.Observable
model.PodcastPlayerModel
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class PodcastPlayerModel
extends java.util.Observable
implements java.io.Serializable
Acts as the model for the PodcastPlayer program. Contains methods to load entire podcasts from XML files or individual audio files from the hard drive. Organizes all of the metadata associated with all of the podcasts and episodes.
Version:
2.0
Author:
seanomeara02, Todd Noecker, Garrett Scott
See Also:
Serialized Form

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes 
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    static class  PodcastPlayerModel.Episode
    Stores all of the metadata for a specific Episode of a Podcast.
    class  PodcastPlayerModel.Podcast
    Stores all of the metadata for a specific podcast, including a list of Episodes in the podcast.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    PodcastPlayerModel()
    Initializes the library as an empty HashMap.

    Loads a local audio file into a Media object.

  • Constructor Details

    • PodcastPlayerModel

      public PodcastPlayerModel()
      Initializes the library as an empty HashMap.

  • Method Details

    • getLibrary

      public java.util.List<PodcastPlayerModel.Podcast> getLibrary()
      Returns a List of all of the currently loaded Podcasts in alphabetical order by title.
      Returns:
      a sorted List of Podcasts.

    • addPodcast

      public void addPodcast​(java.lang.String filePath) throws java.io.IOException, java.net.URISyntaxException
      Loads a new Podcast from an XML file, and stores it in the library.
      Parameters:
      filePath - is a path to an XML file storing data for a podcast.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException
      java.net.URISyntaxException

    • getLocalFile

      public javafx.scene.media.Media getLocalFile() throws java.net.MalformedURLException, java.io.IOException, java.net.URISyntaxException
      Loads a local audio file into a Media object. Neither the file path or the Media object is stored by the model.
      Returns:
      a Media object representing the audio file in a playable format.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException
      java.net.MalformedURLException
      java.net.URISyntaxException

    • getPodcastRSSContent

      public void getPodcastRSSContent() throws java.io.IOException, java.net.URISyntaxException
      Loads a set of podcasts into the podcast Player. An RSS feed is passed to the podcast constructor to be parsed into a podcasts Object with episodes.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException
      java.net.URISyntaxException

    • getEpisode

      public javafx.scene.media.MediaPlayer getEpisode​(java.lang.String podcastName, java.lang.String episodeTitle)
      Returns a MediaPlayer created from one of the loaded Podcast Episodes. The Episode is specified by the name of the Podcast which contains it and the episode name.
      Parameters:
      podcastName - is the title of the Podcast of which this Episode is a part.
      episodeTitle - is the name of the specified Episode.
      Returns:
      a MediaPlayer which plays the specified Episode.

    • savePlayPos

      public void savePlayPos​(javafx.util.Duration curTime)
      This saves the Episodes current play position for future reference.
      Parameters:
      curTime - Duration object.

    • storeModel

      public void storeModel​(java.io.ObjectOutputStream out) throws java.io.IOException
      This method writes its self to file to file.
      Parameters:
      out - output stream associated with a file file to write to.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • loadModel

      public PodcastPlayerModel loadModel​(java.lang.String fileName) throws java.io.IOException, java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
      This will load a model from the save file.
      Parameters:
      fileName - is the name of the file in which the serialized model is stored.
      Returns:
      Model derived from the save file.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - caused by file not existing.
      java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - thrown if the input object isn't a PodcastPlayerModel
